page.title: 13RETAIL SERVICES
page.content: A Post Office is located in a General Store in the High Street. Another General Store is situated a few yards away in the small square at the bottom of Wheeler's Rise. An old public house now houses Croughton Antiques, catering mainly for the US community. Milk is delivered from Banbury, and daily and Sunday newspapers are delivered by arrangement. Mobile butcher/green grocer, fishmonger and fish 'n chip van visit the village, and the Tredwells, who farm at Astwick, beside the base, have a butcher's shop in King's Sutton, and will deliver meat to Croughton customers. A mobile library visits fortnightly, stopping at either end and the centre of the village. The proximity of Brackley and Banbury and the high level of car ownership means that people mainly shop in town.
